body:
Problem: floating window missing statusline

Solution: Use window-local 'statusline' and 'laststatus' to control floating
window statusline visibility.



Fix #16753

comment_regular_data.body:
> When set to true and laststatus is not 0, the statusline will be rendered in floating windows

wouldn't it make sense to *not* render the statusline in floating windows when `laststatus == 3` (global statusline)?

That was also how I implemented it at the beginning, it only rendered when laststatus was 2. But floating windows aren’t organized in the  tree structure as normal windows, so they behave differently. Maybe rendering it when laststatus is 3 could also make sense for some users?

> That was also how I implemented it at the beginning, it only rendered when laststatus was 2. But floating windows aren’t organized in the tree structure as normal windows, so they behave differently. Maybe rendering it when laststatus is 3 could also make sense for some users?

Does this PR change the behavior of `laststatus=3` so the global statusline on the bottom only reflects windows in the tree structure? (as opposed to how it does currently, where it always reflects the active window, even if it's floating) If so, that's great, but if not, wouldn't that just make the same statusline appear twice?
emm when laststatus is set to 3, the statusline of floating windows does not appear in the latest commit.  I think floating windows should also follow the global semantics of laststatus=3 🤔

Just remembered a question that [I asked in the issue](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/16753#issuecomment-1256977133):  'statusline' is already window-local. Why do we need a new WinConfig field?

Note that WinConfig has a `style="minimal"` field, which is the default, and that can also be used to unset 'statusline' by default. And we already do that for 'statuscolumn'...

`laststatus` is a global option, and the visibility of the statusline is controlled by this option. I think you may be mixing up `:help statusline`. this option is global and local-window and defines the statusline expression (the stl format string); it does not control whether the statusline is shown.

> which is the default, and that can also be used to unset 'statusline' by default. And we already do that for 'statuscolumn'...

ok

But who cares about 'laststatus'? Currently, floating windows can show 'statuscolumn' but not 'statusline'. And that isn't because of 'laststatus', which is just a detail.

The main purpose of https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/16753 and this PR is to show statusline in a floatwin.

> using “style” to control the statusline doesn't seem correct. so what would happen if no style field is set? 

If `style="minimal"` is not set then the plugin author has decided they don't want "minimal" style. And they can explicitly `:setlocal statusline=` (empty) in the floatwin if they want.

> would we just render a statusline unconditionally?

It is conditional on whether the window-local 'statusline' option is set, same as all windows. Same as 'statuscolumn' ...

I understand what you mean.  just a bit concerned that floating windows not using style=minimal might end up showing a statusline after this PR, which could introduce some visual noise... But fine, let’s go ahead with it.

> :setlocal statusline= (empty) in the floatwin if they want.

notice we set stl expr in options.lua so this won't work..

> notice we set stl expr in options.lua so this won't work..

That is the default, but `:setlocal` will override it for the floatwin. 

> floating windows not using style=minimal might end up showing a statusline after this PR, which could introduce some visual noise

Yes, plugin authors will need to adapt. In the long run, adding extra, redundant options feels worse for all parties.

> That is the default, but :setlocal will override it for the floatwin.

Sry does this mean that :setlocal stl= will also clear the statusline of floating windows 🤔

> > That is the default, but :setlocal will override it for the floatwin.
> 
> Sry does this mean that :setlocal stl= will also clear the statusline of floating windows 🤔

Yes, 

- `:setlocal statusline=` will disable the statusline for the specific floating window where `:setlocal` was executed. Like any other window-local option. Like how `:setlocal statuscolumn=` already works.
- this should be the default for `style="minimal"`

It's true that `:setlocal statusline=` doesn't work like that for non-floating windows but I don't think that matters?

https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/18660 is related but not a blocker. However, it probably makes sense to work on that as a followup.

'statusline' is not a window-local option. It's a "global or local to window" option. The local value is already empty by default.

However, #18773 already added a special case for 'winbar', so adding the same special case for 'statusline' does make sense.

Yes. So I think the problem can be simplified here. We only need to handle the case where a floating window explicitly sets `setlocal stl`. If it’s non-empty, show the statusline; if it’s empty, clear the statusline. And we still need to respect laststatus. This way, we don’t rely on style,  If use style to control it, then many of the float_spec tests would have to be changed.

now display is controlled through the floating window local stl option and laststatus.
